en: [Entries from the Cherokee Supreme Court Docket, 1823-1834, New Echota] 1827 Oct. 26

This is an excerpt from the Cherokee Supreme Court docket for the years 1823 to 1834. The Cherokee Supreme Court convened annually in New Echota beginning on the second Monday in October and lasting three weeks. This is from the Friday October 26, 1827 session of court, during which a case involving John Ross was heard. The Court also decided that it can rule on matters dating as far back as 1800. Entries from this Supreme Court docket cover items ch100-ch163.

body.value: October Term 1827 Friday 26th Richard Fields Nathan Hicks vs John Ross From the opinion of the circuit Judge. The Court decide that the Courts of Justice have Congnisance Cognizance of Cases transpiring as far back as the year one thousand & eight hundred. 1800_ Court is adjourned untill until tomorrow 9 Oclock
